page.title: 08A STUDY OF EYE CHURCH
page.content: The name{Eye}came from the Saxon word Ea which means water,it used to be spelt Eya.The actual parish is made up of Eye,Croft,Yarpole and Lucton. There was no mention of{Eye}in the first Domesday book in 1068.The land formally was part of the Royal Manor of Leominster and belonged to Edith, wife of Edward the Confessor.In{1125 {Eye}church was given to the Abbey of Reading by Henry the 1st.The first recorded Vicar of{Eye}was Adam de Wakehurst in 1282.Eye Church dates back to about 1190 where it took on the traditonal growth of a parish church having various additions built onto the original nave ,chancel and sanctuary. One of these is the Berrington Chapel which was built for one of the many famous families conected with our area.
